stance_connections.explanation: Rising housing prices lead to displacement and challenges for families trying to move back to San Francisco, indicating a need for more affordable housing options.
Increasing housing supply through development could help stabilize or reduce housing prices, making it easier for families to afford homes.
Efforts to preserve neighborhood character without increasing housing supply can exacerbate rising prices and displacement.

stance_connections.node: Communities of color are often placed in less desirable areas
stance_connections.explanation: Affordable housing policies can help ensure that communities of color have access to more desirable areas, promoting equity.
Providing affordable housing options near employment centers can reduce commute times and improve quality of life for essential workers.
Addressing the high cost of living through affordable housing can give young people more freedom in career choices.
Increasing housing supply can help make the American Dream more attainable by reducing housing costs.
Preserving neighborhood character can help mitigate the displacement effects of gentrification.
Affordable housing policies can help prevent displacement caused by gentrification.
